comments.body: We already have big mushrooms.

Maybe give red mushrooms red planks (since crimson planks are maroon) & brown mushrooms could produce white planks (we have plenty variations of brown for planks but white planks would be a nice change of things).
Mushroom stems r not made of wood in real life so no.
399631869832 Minecraft fungi (wart tree) create wood. Why not mushrooms. I think it would be a good idea because you cant really build a house in the mushroom biome apart from using mycelium.
what would guilding it do
Yea what does guilding do otherwise it sounds cool

I think gilding should make it stronger

I also think it should be purple instead of pink, because purple fits the ender theme better

While I don't agree that there should be a biome dedicated to it, I think including aspects of Alpha & Beta's unique terrain (noise generation) and the iconic biome colors they housed for their grass & water would not only bring back nostalgia but give us reason to find and make houses in these biomes. Alpha's biome would have the signature light green grass, flat terrain, light blue water, & lots of overhangs. Beta biome would have a deeper green with more blue water. It'd be a nice way to bring back Minecraft's roots into the new age of the game.

if its not a realms you can just delete the nether from the world file itself its not that hard and there are probably plenty of guides on the internet already. If its realms tough luck... walk in a direction until you get new terrain like all the other players have since alpha.
A way to escape and get to the overworld would be nice, but it must be difficult and you must get damage over the time

This is a gratis idea

I was originally sceptical of this, but I think this could actually be good if there were end themed biomes beneath the goo, and you would need an enchantment on your helmet called "Gelatinous Breathing" to access them.

Verdict: Interesting - could open up new possibilities for the end. You have my vote.

wow thats actually a great idea I wish they added that

I would like to know the point of this dimension, or why it would exist. It would honestly be cool if this place was the nether's surface instead of a dimension, as it works as an expansion to an already existing dimension.
I know Africa has a lot of diamonds so maybe diamonds could be more frequently found here like gold in masa’s.
Best idea!

This is an amazing idea, as it gives a unique solution to a problem, while adding even more

These nests could hold maps to piglin bastions.
You can fix your Nether portal by getting obsidian from Nether Fortresses. However, I do support the idea that they should have canyons where you can find Ancient Debris at the bottom.
Just just how much since the debris? Because if this is how I think it is, it’s just a valley of diamonds

I mean a 1:4000 Chance

This sounds cool, but I think it would be quite boring mining down there... I think they would have to add something else down there to spice things up... (aka how they have dungeons, strongholds, mineshafts, etc above, have something different below).

Tho I always wanted what Terraria had - just keep mining down to get to the nether, and a portal was simply a quick way down.
This sounds great! I find it slightly sad that when my friend and I were playing on a new survival world, it took us around 30 minutes, or less, to get diamond tools. (Thanks, ravine!)

Ah exactly got the same idea but when you get deeper, you would see giant underground lake with ruins, several ores like amber-ruby-amethyst to finally have mithril/orichalcum at the really bottom. I know I would have fun mining deeper, if we also have structures like miners villagers refuges or glow mushrooms.

With cubic chunks and practically infinite caves there should also be biomes dotted around the underground in various shapes and sizes that contain unique blocks mobs in structures that affect the way caves generate. Just like the surface now
No. Adding any mods into Miencraft can already be done so don't ask Moajng to add it in.
why have people not voted for this?
This sounds great!
I like this idea and I had an idea for a new type of gravel that could go well with it that drops blaze powder instead of flint
Would the Gravel Desert look like this?

Cool, I will support this, but I think a tundra biome would be better, like a cold desert with it rarely snowing except when there is maybe a thunderstorm in the more temperate and hot biomes then snow should factor in like rain during a thunderstorm in the desert, normal rain, nothing should happen other than clouds. Tundra biomes should generate near ice-spikes and icebergs and have grayed version of podzol and moss stone covering the area with some patches of snow and plenty of frozen water sources and rolling hills.
Clarified topic a bit to separate/differentiate it from the other one. (Makes it better to search for.)
This would make exploring much more fun, but perhaps the 'photograph' would instead be a rare painting, because in minecraft the technology for photographs haven't been invented yet.
I was thinking of a "picture" - that could also be interpreted as a "painting" - Changing subject and text accordingly, thanks @Some Animal

Thank you, leondsl, for the punctual reply, I understand the way people could interpret it. Also, would the pictures always depict the same thing? And would they have biomes such as a Shattered Savanna biome or Jungle Edge biome, or just include the main biomes-Jungle, Savanna, Plains etc. Also, If the world seed does not have a specific biome, would you be able obtain the Biome Paintings? Would you be able to craft the Biome Locators? Would the Biome Locater have a chance of breaking like an Eye of Ender?

regarding your questions, Some Animal, here my ideas:

- Either the pictures would always depict the same thing, in example, for desert, always the same desert picture. Or Mojang could hold a competition every update to make the best biome-based screenshot, this screenshot would be used as the picture for the next "season".

- I would recommend to only use the "main" biomes.

- I do not understand the concept of a world seed not "having a specific biome", can you clarify this? I am talking about the overworld of the unmodded Vanilla Minecraft.

- As mentioned, the biome locators would be crafted from the picture and an endereye, either in a crafting table or (recommended) in the cartography table.

- For it is much easier to spot a biome rather than a fortress (for it is underground), I would recommend even having an increased chance of breaking - just like the Eye of Ender.
